question.text: She blamed him … the murder.
They arrived … London at 7:30.
I must apologise … Mary … the delay.
I am very annoyed … John …being so careless.
He was accused … being a thief.
He believes … God.
Everybody congratulated him … passing his exams.
The police have charged him … murder.
What time will you have finished painting your room? I will have finished … 7 o'clock, I hope.
Are you seeing Julie tonight? No, I will have left … the time she gets here.
Her family couldn't decide … the best place to go for their summer holidays.
The mountain-climbers died … extreme cold.
Sally dreams … being a famous actress.
What's the difference… a rabbit and a hare?
Sam was so disappointed … his birthday present that he burst into tears.
The demand … new cars is low because they are so expensive.
Linda couldn't deal … all the typing, so she hired an assistant to help her.
Now that he has a good job, Paul doesn't depend … his parents for money.
A footballer's life starts … the weekend.
Most people go out … Friday night, but I have to be in bed at 10 o'clock.
I go to school every day … 9 o'clock.
Lessons start at 9.15 am … Mondays and Tuesdays.
John Barnes has been in the police force …1980.
Before that he worked in a supermarket … two years, but he found it very boring.
I met my penfriend, Bid, four days ...
I had never met him …
We went to a few tropical islands … the summer holiday last year.
My parents spent most of their time in the hotel … I was sunbathing on the beach.
Mr. Savage was driving very fast last night because he wanted to be home … for the late film.
He knew it probably wouldn't start … but he didn't want to take any chances.
When I went out last Saturday 1 told my father I'd be back ... 7 o'clock at the latest.
However, I was having such a good time that I didn't even look at my watch … 2:30!
My father was furious and told me I'd have to be home at 7 o'clock every night of the week … the end of the month!
I'm in trouble with my history teacher. He gave us a project to finish ... a week, and I haven't even started it yet.
I was going to do it … dinner on Thursday, but my friend phoned and invited me out to the cinema.
We stayed at the party … 11 o'clock … 3.00 in the morning.

part.text: Выберите правильный вариант употребления предлога или наречия, пользуясь таблицей

question.text: break down 1) ломаться, прекратить работать; 2) потерять контроль над чувствами break into(+ object) 1) проникнуть; 2) внезапно начинать что-либо делать bring up вырастить, воспитать carry on (with) продолжить carry out сделать, завершить что-либо hold back контролировать (себя, толпу и т. д.) hold on ожидать (по телефону) hold up 1) задерживать 2) грабить, обкрадывать кого-либо/что-либо My car broke … on the motorway and I had to walk to a garage.

break down 1) ломаться, прекратить работать; 2) потерять контроль над чувствами break into(+ object) 1) проникнуть; 2) внезапно начинать что-либо делать bring up вырастить, воспитать carry on (with) продолжить carry out сделать, завершить что-либо hold back контролировать (себя, толпу и т. д.) hold on ожидать (по телефону) hold up 1) задерживать 2) грабить, обкрадывать кого-либо/что-либо They carried … a survey to find out which TV channel was the most popular.

Mrs. Jones' line is engaged at the moment.
